objenome.op.math

Class DoubleERC

  • java.lang.Object
    • objenome.op.Node<Void,X>
      • objenome.op.Literal<java.lang.Double>
        • objenome.op.Doubliteral
          • objenome.op.math.DoubleERC
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class DoubleERC
extends Doubliteral
    Defines a double ephemeral random constant (ERC). An ERC is a literal with a value which is randomly generated upon construction. This implementation will generate a double value of the specified precision between the lower and upper bounds provided. All values between the two bounds (inclusive), can appear with equal probability. As with all nodes, instances may be constructed in any of 3 ways:
    • constructor - the new instance will be initialised with a value of null.
    • clone method - will return an instance with a value equal to the cloned value.
    • newInstance method - will return a new instance with a new, randomly generated value.
    Since:
    2.0
    See Also:
    BooleanERC, IntegerERC

    • Constructor Detail

      • DoubleERC

        public DoubleERC(RandomSequence random,
                 double lower,
                 double upper,
                 int precision)
        Constructs a new DoubleERC with a value of null. The given random number generator will be be used to generate a new value if the newInstance method is used.
        Parameters:
        random - the random number generator to use if randomly generating a double value.
        lower - the inclusive lower bound of values that are generated.
        upper - the inclusive upper bound of values that are generated.
        precision - the non-negative int precision.

                 double v)

    • Method Detail

      • newInstance

        public DoubleERC newInstance()
        Constructs a new DoubleERC node with a randomly generated value, selected using the random number generator. The value will be randomly selected with an equal probability from the set of values between the lower and upper bounds and of the specified precision.
        Overrides:
        newInstance in class Literal<java.lang.Double>
        Returns:
        a new DoubleERC instance with a randomly generated value.

      • mutated

        public DoubleERC mutated(double percentChange)

      • generateValue

        protected double generateValue()
        Generates and returns a new double value for use in a new DoubleERC instance. This implementation will return a value selected randomly from the set of values between the lower and upper bounds, inclusively. The value will be returned with the specified precision.
        Returns:
        a double value to be used as the value of a new DoubleERC instance.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the random number generator is null.

      • getRandomSequence

        public RandomSequence getRandomSequence()
        Returns the random number generator that is currently being used to generate double values for new DoubleERC instances.
        Returns:
        the random number generator

      • setRandomSequence

        public void setRandomSequence(RandomSequence random)
        Sets the random number generator to be used for generating the double value of new DoubleERC instances.
        Parameters:
        random - the random number generator to set
